snippet: The state seeks to suspend same-sex unions that became legal when a federal judge struck down the state’s voter-approved ban.
abstract: Leaders in socially conservative Utah are asking United States Supreme Court to suspend same-sex unions that became legal when a federal judge struck down the state’s voter-approved ban; say state will suffer serious harm as same-sex marriages continue in county courthouses and government buildings across the state.
lead_paragraph: The state seeks to suspend same-sex unions that became legal when a federal judge struck down the state’s voter-approved ban.

headline.main: Utah Asks Highest Court to Suspend Gay Marriage
headline.print_headline: Utah Asks Highest Court To Suspend Gay Marriage

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
